message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS 

This paper discusses the performance degradation phenomenon in online recommender systems, which is a common problem in machine learning. The proposed solution involves a neural-optimized Partially Observable Markov Decision Process algorithm, which falls under the category of reinforcement learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the evolution of users' interests, which is related to information retrieval (cs.IR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the use of accumulated historical data relates to data science (cs.DS) and the optimization of the algorithm relates to computational intelligence (cs.SI).
